page.title: 14SOCIAL CONCERN IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: Social concern in Southrepps goes back generations, provided by forebears with Town Lands Charities,allotments, and recreational area including the Village Hall. CHURCH GROUPS meet dis- cussing newcomers, needy, sick, lonely, etc, and social and fund rais- ing activities, and provide hospital/ emergency car service for those with- out transport. BRITISH LEGION is responsible for care of ex-members and relatives, providing finance, advice, transport, etc. TOWN LANDS CHARITY TRUSTEES distribute invest- ment income to needy, elderly and handicapped. STATE provides home help, meals-on-wheels, and social work visiting whereby the needy are brought to the notice of doctors, clinics or other caring bodies. About 20 organ- isations provide communication oppor- tunities for friendly neighbourliness.
